intro: Bigelowia paniculata, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a perennial herb native to New Zealand. It belongs to the genus Bigelowia in the family Asteraceae, and is characterized by its robust, fibrous stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flower heads that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its fibrous bark has historically been used by Māori for making clothing and ropes. Bigelowia paniculata is well adapted to coastal and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
